result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Dolvon Tucker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward Dolvon Tucker appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Edward Dolvon Tucker.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and recently received an offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09-02-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Edward Dolvon Tucker in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Edward Dolvon Tucker
Current: 3416 N 5th St., Milwaukee, WI 53212 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: 8506 West Congress Street, Milwaukee, WI 53225
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Edward Dolvon Tucker not in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/19/22 @ 1:30p
